name: Number of records in the n-th composition in standard order.
comment: Here a record is a part of the composition that is greater than all parts before it, reading left to right. The first part of any non-empty composition is a record so a(n) >= 1 for n > 0. See A066099 for the standard order of integer compositions.
The first appearance of k occurs at n = A164894(k) for k > 0.
example: The 883rd composition is (1, 2, 1, 1, 3, 1, 1) with records 1, 2, and 3; so a(883) = 3.
author: _John Tyler Rascoe_, Mar 20 2025
